intro: Stevenia incana, commonly known as the white hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has palmate leaves with a soft, fuzzy texture, and it thrives in warm, humid climates. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Stevenia incana is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other hibiscus species.
